He has made a living by cultivating corn and beans for the last 21 years, selling his products at agencies for the buying and selling of basic grains that are near his place of residence. With the earnings he obtains from he sales, he is able to cover some household expenses.

Antonio is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc. to be able to obtain better earnings and give his family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Ten

texts.en:
Ten is 26 years old and a single woman. She has a low education due to financial constraints in her family. She decided to become involved in the farming business to earn a livelihood in Kompong Cham province. She plants rice and mung beans and sells them to local traders after harvest season. She is very hardworking and aims to move ahead in her business. She has been engaged in farming for over five years. Thanks to her business, today she is able to earn a net income of KHR 40,000 per day.

In order to help her maintain her crops, she has requested a loan in the amount of KHR 2,500,000 to buy farm supplies and pay laborers for land preparation. She wants to use the earnings from the loan to reinvest into her business and achieve a stable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay laborers for land preparation.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera  vive en casa propia  junto a su hijo de 17 años quien actualmente estudia, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 17 años es una persona muy responsable, honesta y amble con sus clientes estas razones la han llevado han ser una costurera con mucho prestigio y demanda en la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos en el hogar. Cándida solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como telas, zippers, botones, agujas, hilos, etc. Para continuar con su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
39-year old Cándida is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 17-year old son who is currently studying. Cándida has been making clothing for 17 years. She is a responsible and honest person who is friendly to her clients and as a result she has a good reputation and is in demand in her neighbourhood. She is able to cover a lot of her household expenses with the profits she makes from her work.

Cándida is asking for a loan to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, zips, buttons, needles, thread etc. so she can continue with her business, make better profits and improve her own and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zips, buttons, needles, thread etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 40 years old married to Rose and they have three children who are in school.

He is in the transport business in Naivasha town where he has operated for the past six years. He also has a shop which is run by his wife. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to repair his motorbike and buy flour and sugar, among others, for his shop. He plans to buy a motorbike with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Jackson hopes to buy a Nissan so as to increase his income.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and buy stock for the shop such as flour and sugar among others.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a 43-year-old widowed mother of four in Thika. She earns a living for her family by operating a quarry. She earns a monthly income of KES 23,200, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. Annastacia is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to purchase mining tools and employ additional casual workers. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. 

In the future, Annastacia plans to continue to invest in her business and purchase a piece of land to construct a permanent residential house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase mining tools and employ additional casual workers.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 35, is married and has a son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker at a garment factory.

Thanh has been running a business of selling construction components and equipment in front of his house for 15 years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying different construction materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his child to school.

loans.use: To buy construction components and equipment.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married 57-year-old mother of two and lives in Poblacion Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Her husband worked as a laborer and at the same time farms their own farm to make a living. She plants and harvests rice for family consumption and sells a portion for their daily needs.  

She joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to micro-finance services. Recently, Luzviminda borrowed 30,000 PHP  to purchase lumber in order to repair their house. A portion of this loan will also be used for the placement fee of her child who plans to work abroad. 

She is thankful to GDMPC that gives them access to micro-finance services and helps to fulfill their plans to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase lumber in order to repair their house and for the placement fee of her child.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, a 51-year-old married father of three from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a retail shop which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This is his first loan term with KADET after he was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

With the loan that he has applied for from KADET Ltd., James will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Additional income created will allow him to improve his retail shop by purchasing more stock. In the future, James would like to expand the current businesses so that his children can take over as he ages. 

He hopes to construct a permanent residential house and have a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, age 40, runs a boutique shop where she sells clothing items to earn a living. She has operated her business for the past 20 years. She lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda with her husband and their two children, both of whom are currently attending school. 
 
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell in her shop. This will help Stella to generate greater profits and pay some of her children's school fees. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a bigger shop. 
 
Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Djénéba est une célibataire de 25 ans et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit avec son enfant chez ses parents dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Mademoiselle Djénéba est diplômé en Secrétariat de Direction. Après avoir eu son diplôme, elle est resté longtemps sans avoir un emploi. Ainsi pour subvenir à ses besoins elle décide de mener des activités génératrices notamment l’achat et la vente des habits, chaussures et parfums. Elle appris cette activité auprès de son amie et de ma mère. Avec 5 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité. Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant elle, décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes, 10 cartons de parfums et 10 paires de chaussures de différentes qualités. Elle est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et . tous les  deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali )et parfois au Burkina. La vente se fait à la maison et dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni. La plus-part de ses clients sont les femmes. Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Avec ses bénéfices elle envisage améliorer son activité, aider ses parents dans les dépenses de la famille, et à payer les intérêts.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle Djénéba is single, 25 years old and mother to 1 child. She lives with her child at the home of her parents in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

Mademoiselle Djénéba has a diploma in secretarial management. After having received her diploma, she went a long time without having a job. Thus in order to meet her needs she decided to manage businesses that would generate income, notably buying and selling clothing, shoes and perfumes. She learned this business from her friend and her mother. With 5 years experience, she has mastered her business. To obtain a consistent working capital she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 pieces of pagnes [African fabric], 10 cartons of perfumes and 10 pairs of shoes of different qualities. She is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and both preceding loans were correctly repaid.

She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of the republic of Mali) and sometimes in Burkina. She sells from home and in the different neighborhoods of Bougouni. Most of her clients are women. With this loan, she plans to make a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. With her profits she envisions improving her business, helping her parents with the family expenses, and paying the interest.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items.

loans.name: Fassery Coulibaly

texts.fr:
Natif de Bougouni, Monsieur Fassery est un homme marié de 41 et père de 3 enfants. Il réside avec ses femmes et ses enfants chez son feu père à Bougouni dans le quartier Niebala.
Monsieur Fassery a vite abandonné l’école pour devenir un apprenti chauffeur. Dix années plus tard il obtient son permis de conduire. Ce qui fait qu’il transporte les commerçants pour les différents marchés hebdomadaires. C’est comme ça qu’il c’est  lui aussi s’intéressé aux activités génératrice de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès des commerçants. 
Avec une expérience de plus de 5 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Après une longue réflexion, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter 20 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de petit mil.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants mais aussi dans le Wassoulou pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché de Bougouni et  une partie à Yanfolila ses clients son surtout les commerçants. Il est à son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les 2 prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA. C’est avec ses bénéfices qu’il envisage subvenir à ses dépenses, payer les intérêts du prêt et a agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
A native of Bougouni, Mister Fassery is a 41 year old married man and father to 3 children. He lives with his wives and his children at the home of his father-in-law in Bougouni in the Niebala neighborhood.

Mister Fassery soon left school to become a driver's apprentice. Ten years later he got his driver's license. He drives shopkeepers to the different weekly markets. In this way he also became interested in income generating businesses notably buying and selling cereals. He learned this business from the shopkeepers.

With more than 5 years experience, he is skilled in his business.

After much reflection, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to buy 20 bags of corn and 10 bags of millet.

He gets his supplies in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages but also in Wassoulou to then resell at the Bougouni market and in Yanfolila. His clients are mostly shopkeepers. He is on his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Both preceding loans were correctly repaid.

With this loan he envisions making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA. It's with these profits that he envisions meeting his expenses, paying the interest of the loan and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 27 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Karina consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería como talcos, desodorantes, perfumes, colonias, lápiz labial, cremas de ojos entre otros. Trabaja en su casa en donde tiene instalado una pequeña vitrina de exhibición que le permite mostrar mejor su mercadería. Sus clientes se encuentran distribuidos por diversas calles de la ciudad, sus principales clientes son sus amigos y conocidos, trabaja bajo el sistema de venta crediticia, cumple esta función desde hace 4 años. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite poder estar en constante actividad durante el día generar ingresos para su hogar tranquilamente, además que le da tiempo por las noches de descansar y recargar energías para el día siguiente, espera continuar trabajando y progresar y más adelante establecer una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su propia casa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado, comprará talcos, cremas corporales, cremas de manos y algunos perfumes para que continúe realizando sus ventas.
texts.en: Karina is 27 years old and is a single mother of two children who live with her in their own home.  She works selling makeup and perfume products like talcum powders, deodorants, perfumes, cologne, lip stick, eye creme, and other items.  She works from home where she has a small display case installed that allows her to better show off her merchandise.  Her customers come from many different parts of the city, and her principle clients are friends and acquaintances.  She works under a system of sale on credit, and has been working in this area for four years.  She likes her work since it allows her to be active all day long and generate income for her home in a relaxed manner.  It also gives her time at night to rest and recharge her energy for the next day.  She is hoping to continue working and to in the future establish a store where she sells groceries from her own home.  At this time she is asking for 1000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency).  She is very excited and grateful for the economic support that has been offered to help her complete her plans.  She also promises to make repayments in a punctual manner.  With the requested loan, she will buy talcum powders, body cremes, hand cremes, and some perfumes in order to continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy talcum powders, body cremes, hand cremes, and perfume

loans.name: Jose Antonio ,

texts.es: Don José de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 21 y 13 años de edad, él se dedica al  cultivo de maíz y jocote desde hace varios años, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, cualidades  que lo han llevado a ser muy reconocido en la zona donde comercializa sus cosechas, además de la frescura y calidad de sus productos, ha logrado obtener gran clientela que lo prefieren, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, don José solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y herramientas que faciliten su trabajo y le ayuden obtener mayores ingresos , y así mejorar  su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their three children aged 22, 21 and 13. For several years José has earned a living growing corn and 'jocote' [a type of plum]. He is a responsible, honest and hard-working person, qualities which have made him well known in the area where he sells his crops. He is also known for the freshness and quality of his produce and has built up a large clientele who prefer him. His work has enabled him to cover some of his household expenses.

José is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilisers and tools which will make his work easier and help him to generate a better income. This will help him to improve his own and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers and tools.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Don Carlos de 42 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada con su esposa y su hijo de 17 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta y cultivo de pilones de café, vende sus cultivos en los mercados de compra de café que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Carlos solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así seguir con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old and lives in a rented house with his wife and their 17-year-old son who is currently studying. For the last 10 years Carlos has earned a living growing and selling coffee plants. He sells the plants in the coffee market which is near his home and is able to cover some of his household expenses with the profits he makes.

Carlos is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilisers, herbicides etc. so he can continue with his crops which are his only source of work. This will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, herbicides etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a man of seventy-three years, married to Jane. He lives with one of his grandsons. He owns rental houses in Kinoo, in the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for twenty years, earning a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.

This will be James's eighth loan with KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy building materials, so that he can finish building other rental houses. In future, James desires to improve his living standard, and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials, like cement, to use for finishing rental houses

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna, age 54, is a farmer in Guingona, Ozamiz City. She and her husband operate their own farm, where they grow bananas, corn, and root crops to earn a living. They have two adult children who also help operate the family farm. A portion of the harvested produce is used for family consumption, and Miraluna personally offers the rest for sale at the local market.

Her previous loan funds from Gata Daku MPC provided additional capital for the operation of her general store, which allows her to earn additional income. She has successfully repaid her loans and is now requesting PhP 6,000 in order to buy fertilizers for her farm.  

Miraluna hopes to generate more income in order to pursue her plan of repairing the family house, which will allow the family to experience better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Jinypher

texts.en: Jinypher is 25 years old and is single. She lives in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. For more than four years, she had stopped studying, for there were some hindrances that happened along her way. Lately, she decided to continue, in order to pursue her dream.  She joined Gata Daku MPC recently, and she borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to cover her first-semester tuition. Jinypher is in her fourth year of studying for a Bachelor of Science in Education, at   La Salle University in Ozamiz City. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping students to continue their studies. She hopes to finish her course and be able to work as a teacher, someday.

loans.use: to cover her first-semester tuition.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita, age 44, runs a retail gasoline sales business to earn a living. She has been running her business for five years and also earns an income from running a small general store as well as from selling charcoal. She works hard to provide for her family. She and her husband have one child.
 
Leonita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. Her loan funds helped her to further build her businesses. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

She aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She is requesting a new one to buy pig feed and repair her breeding facilities. Phuong hopes that the loan will help her to increase the size of her business and income, thereby enabling her to  improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to repair her breeding facilities

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a food vendor. She prepares and sells cooked food from her home to members of the general public. Her primary challenges are seasonality and lack of enough capital to ensure the continuity of the business.

Mwanamkasi and her husband have four school-going children and live in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She decided to join Yehu in order to obtain financial assistance for improving her business. With her loan funds of Kshs 40,000, Mwanamkasi intends to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen would like to take an additional loan to buy pig feed and repair breeding facilities. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to repair breeding facilities

loans.name: Quen

texts.en:
Quen would like to take an additional loan to buy more chickens, piglets, and fish. Quen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chickens, and fish.

loans.name: Norma Lorena

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada; su pareja trabaja como motorista del transporte publico. Tiene 3 hijos de 20 y las gemelas de 17, de los cuales solo sus dos hijas gemelas viven con ella, y están estudiando el bachillerato, su hijo esta acompañado y trabaja como vendedor en una comercial. 

Ella, es una persona a la que le gusta mucho el comercio, toda su vida se a dedicado a vender ropa, es la única actividad económica que a realizado. Viaja en autobús a las ciudades cercanas de donde vive, para comercializar la ropa, su horario de trabajo son desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más ropa para todas las edades. Para continuar comercializando y generar ingresos para mantener a su familia. El préstamo sera de mucho beneficio al brindarle la oportunidad de seguir con su negocio y asegurando sus ingresos. 

Con las ganancias generadas de la inversión, espera ir cancelando el crédito y ahorrar una parte porque le gustaría adquirir un local  donde comercializar su mercadería, y poseer un vehículo para transportarla y no tener que viajar en bus. también desea seguirles dando el estudio a sus hijas para que se superen con una carrera universitaria;pero sabe que lograra si se sigue esforzando como lo ha hecho hasta hoy.
texts.en:
Norma is a 39-year-old woman who studied up to the 9th grade and is in a relationship. Her partner works as a driver for public transport. She has three children, a 20-year-old and 17-year-old twins, of which only her twin daughters live with her and are studying for their high school degrees. Her son is in a relationship and works as a salesman in a store.

She is someone who likes sales very much. She has made a living by selling clothing for her entire life; this is the only work she has done. She travels to the cities near where she lives by bus in order to sell clothing. Her work schedule is from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m.

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy more clothing for all ages in order to keep selling and generating income to maintain her family. The loan will be of much benefit in providing her the opportunity to continue with her business and ensuring her income.

With the earnings generated from the investment, she hopes to pay off the loan and save a part because she would like to acquire a space to sell her clothing and to possess a vehicle to transport herself and not have to travel via bus. She also wants to help her daughters keep studying so that they can attain a university education. She knows that she will succeed if she keeps striving as she has to date.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for all ages

loans.name: Santiago Mauricio

texts.es:
Santiago es un joven esposo y padre de 30 años, tuvo la oportunidad de prepararse en educación superior, sin embargo no le fue fácil conseguir un empleo, está casado con Eliana de 26 años con quien tiene 1 hijo de apenas un año de edad, ellos se casaron siendo muy jóvenes y han tenido que trabajar muy duro para solventar sus necesidades como familia. Santiago vive con su esposa e hijo en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. También es una ciudad ideal para actividades de comercio por el paso de turistas en la ciudad y las necesidades de sus habitantes. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
Santiago al vivir la dura experiencia de la falta de oportunidades laborales en su ciudad y aún en las ciudades aledañas, decidió emprender su propio negocio hace un par de años, aplicando los conocimientos de administración que obtuvo en su formación académica. Invierte por lo menos 8 horas cada día en su Centro de Cómputo en donde acuden estudiantes de escuelas, colegios, universitarios, ejecutivos e inclusive familias a hacer uso del servicio de internet, cámara web y de los programas computacionales. A veces el tiempo invertido se prolonga por el mantenimiento minucioso que debe hacer a los equipos. A medida que Santiago ha incrementado los servicios y ha trabajado en mejorar cada día la atención a sus clientes, la demanda ha crecido y muchas veces personas esperan para poder tener acceso a un computador, por esta razón, este hombre emprendedor solicita un crédito con el cual comprará más computadoras que las ubicará en el espacio disponible que le queda en el local, de esta forma podrá atender a todas las personas que llegan en busca de los servicios que se presta en su local y así incrementar sus ingresos que le ayuden a brindar a su familia un estilo de vida de calidad y un día poder cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 30, is a young husband and father.  He had the chance to get a higher education.  Nevertheless, it was not easy to find employment.  He is married to Eliana, age 26, and they have one child who is just one year old.  They got married when they were very young, and they have had to work very hard to pay for the family’s necessities.

Santiago lives with his wife and child in the Salcedo canton, which is in the eastern part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces in the Ecuadorian mountains.  There are various tourist attractions like lakes and spas in Salcedo.  They offer extreme sports for adventurous tourists.  However, the main business activity in this town is farming and, to a lesser extent, livestock.  It is also an ideal city for commerce because of the tourists that pass through the city and the inhabitants’ necessities.  In spite of these productive activities, there are very worrisome indicators of illiteracy and poverty because basic needs are not met.  An example is the sewer service that only 25% have in their homes.

Upon living the difficult experience of the lack of work opportunities in his city, and even in surrounding cities, Santiago decided to undertake his own business two years ago.  He applies the knowledge of administration that he got when going to school.  He spends at least eight hours each day at his Computer Center.  This is where students from elementary school, high school, universities, and executives, including families, go to make use of internet service, web camera, and computer programs.   Sometimes he spends more time there because of the meticulous maintenance he needs to perform on the equipment.

As Santiago has increased the service and worked every day to improve customer service, the demand has grown.  People often wait to be able to have access to a computer.  For this reason, this enterprising man is requesting a loan to buy more computers.  He will place them in the available space that he has at his place.  This way he will be able to tend to all of the people who arrive seeking the services he offers at his place.  This way he will increase his income that will help him provide his family with a quality lifestyle.  One day he will be able to fulfill his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy computers for his business.

loans.name: Adiel

texts.es: Adiel tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y  vive con ellos en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Adiel tiene 11 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de granos básicos, como maíz y frijoles, además vende pan y refrescos de manera ambulante. Los granos básicos los compra a los productores al por mayor y lo vende al detalle en su casa y de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 18,000 Lempiras es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y lo utilizara para comprar maíz, frijoles, pan, refrescos y otros productos básicos para tener surtido y poder incrementar las ventas. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para ofrecer mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Adiel, 36, is married and has 5 children. He lives with them in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. Adiel has been buying and selling basic grains, like corn and beans for 11 years. He also sells bread and soft drinks, as an itinerant vendor. He buys the grains from growers at wholesale and resells them at retail from home and as an itinerant vendor. He is requesting an 18,000 Lempira loan, which he will use to buy corn, beans, bread, refreshments and other basic products to have stock on hand in order to increase sales. His goal is to grow his business so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn, beans, bread, refreshments and other basic products to stock up his business.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She has a second-hand clothing sales business, to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a bigger business, but she does not have enough working capital. She feels good about her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan. She will use the loan amount, $1,000, to buy some additional inventory to keep in her store, such as dresses, short dresses, shirts with sleeves, pants, and shorts. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to sell, such as dresses, shirts, pants, and shorts

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore loves her animals and especially her pigs and piglets. 
“They are adorable and smart animals, too. It’s easy taking care of them and there is plenty of feed for them here in the village; they can eat rotten fruits and veggies and all these wild veggies. Cows/goats/sheep are a bit more selective of their food. However, my pigs want to take showers and get their backs scratched now in the summer and I find it very cute,” is what Vitore said smiling.
Vitore is in her early sixties and is requesting a loan for the first time to build a proper stable for the pigs and piglets because currently, the one you see in the background is their stable. 
In addition to her livestock activity, Vitore makes woolen carpets and rugs.

loans.use: to build a proper stable for her pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Kheourn's Group

texts.en:
A hardworking cassava farmer, Kheourn is 58 years old and has been blessed with three children. She lives in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, where she farms on a seven-hectares area of land. Having engaged in this business for 30 years, Kheourn is able to earn up to 16,700 KHR per day. 

Kheourn, a second-time borrower, has formed a group of two, to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Her previous loan enabled her to support her business on time and earn a decent income. In particular, she has been able to provide decent meals three times per day, for her kids.

For this new loan cycle, she is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, and her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Kheourn will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay fees for labor to plow, cultivate, and reap. She hopes to grow her crops timely and get a good yield, with high profit to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay fees for farm labor

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Therefore, her husband appears in the photo, which he posed for while he was there, working at the chicken farm.

Laila is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is the mother five young children. Her husband is a worker with a low wage; it is not enough to cover all the family expenses. Laila and her husband also have a chicken farm. The children help with the farm, after school. It is a profitable project, but it needs some improvements.
 
Laila took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chickens for her farm and chicken feed. This will improve her project, and the income from the farm will increase. Laila would like to take a bigger loan in the future, to improve this chicken farm even more.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her farm, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “EMPRENDEDORES DE VITARTE” una de ellas es la sra.   Marlene de 45 años casada y con 3  hijos,la sra. Marlene se dedica ya hace 10 años a la venta de calzado de zapatos tanto para damas como para caballeros  en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas,Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la sra.marlene  ha logrado mejorar la educacion de sus hijos y también  Seguir mejorando en su negocio,Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más calzados y así poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Marlene  se encuentra sentada se le distingue con su chompa de color rojo , A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Emprendedores de Vitarte" is comprised of eight women who are involved in different business activities.  One of them is Marlene, 45, who is married and has three children.  Marlene has been selling men's and women's shoes from a small stall for ten years in an effort to get ahead and earn extra income.  Through her hard effort, Marlene has been able to improve her children's education and also continue improving her business.

She will use the loan to buy more shoes to increase her income.  

Marlene is the one wearing a red sweater.  She sends her regards to Kiva and Edaprospo and is grateful for the loan that allows her to prosper.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Carmen Consuelo's Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen es casa  tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales  uno depende de ella. Carmen se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace 10 años. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido salir adelante dándole así una mejor  calidad de vida a su familia. También se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.  Actualmente su ingreso lo destina para ayudar en los gastos del hogar . Su plan para el futuro es tener una  bodega. Ella usara  el crédito en la compra de de golosinas  para su negocio. Carmen  pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Amigas Unidas del Rosal”, el cual está conformado por 8 personas. Ella lleva el cargo de presidenta.La Sra. Carmen es la persona que se encuentra de pie con una chompa de color morado al costado de la otra señora.
texts.en:
Carmen is married and has two children, one of whom depends on her.  Carmen sells sweets for a living and has been in business for ten years.  With much effort and hard work she has been able to get ahead and give her family a good quality of life.  She also sells beauty products and uses her income to cover household expenses.  In the future she would like to have a store.  She will use the loan to buy sweets for her business.

Carmen belongs to the communal bank "Amigas Unidas del Rosal", which is comprised of eight members.  She is the president of the group.  Carmen is the one standing wearing a purple hoodie.

loans.use: To buy sweets.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Villa Group

texts.es: la sra. Maela de 30 años de edad casada y con 1 hijo,la sra. maela se dedica ya hace 2 años a la venta de productos de belleza  en un pequeño  puesto todos los días con el merito de sacar adelante a su hijo , la sra. maela  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su casa, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de belleza y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en ampliar su negocio de productos de belleza  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la sra.  maela es la segunda de la mano izquierda se le  puede observar con una casaca rosada.se despide con un abraso a Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Maela, 30, is married and has a son.  For two years she has been selling beauty products at a small stall in order to provide for her son.  She claims to have loyal customers and earns enough income to cover household expenses.  In the future she would like to have her own beauty products store so she can earn more income.

With the loan she will expand her beauty products business and earn more money.  Maela is the second from the left wearing a pink jacket.  She sends her regards to Kiva with the message that she is determined to meet all the goals she has planned.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: la Sra. giovanna de 30 años soltera y con 3  hijos, la Sra. Giovanna se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de ropa para niños en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia y poder pagar los colegios de sus hijos con el esfuerzo que tiene de salir adelante ,  la Sra. Giovanna   ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio , su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropas para niños  y así poder tener más ingresos.la sra. giovanna se encuentra con un polo de color verde  A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 30 years old, single, with no children. Giovanna has made a living for three years through the sale of children’s clothing, working in a small store every day. She has had the goal of coming out ahead and so be able to help her family and be able to pay her children’s schools. Using the strength that she has to come out ahead, Giovanna has managed to improve her economy and improve her quality of life, and so continue improving her business. Her greatest dream in life is that her children become professionals.

She will invest the loan awarded to her in the purchase of more children’s clothes, and so be able to have a better income. Giovanna is wearing a green t-shirt. At the same time, she says goodbye to Kiva and Edaprospo with a hug, and is thankful for the loan provided since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Marizela Magali

texts.es: Marizela   de 18 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de  administración de  hotelería y turismo, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres  marizela  ha sabido salir adelante y estudiar mucho, así poder culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Marizela  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marizela, 18 years old, is single with no children. She is a kind student of Hotel and Tourism Administration. She studies a lot to reach her goals in life. With the help of her parents, Marizela has known how to come out ahead and study a lot, and so be able to finish her studies and be successful in life.

With the loan awarded, she will be able to make her university tuition payments and buy the educational supplies that she needs. Marizela is very thankful for the help provided, and she says goodbye to Kiva with a strong hug, telling them that she will complete her promise of coming out ahead.

loans.use: to buy educational supplies.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru: Наталия добрая и честная женщина. Ей 54 года. Она разведена. Ее муж бросил ее, и она осталась без кормильца. Наталия работает в частной производственной организации более 10 лет. Она трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому выполняет свою работу качественно. Она выполняет должность начальника отдела заготовки. Она сама обеспечивает себя и ей не на кого надеется, так как она не имеет детей. Она хочет купить кондиционер, так как летом ей очень жарко и мебель для своего дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки мебели и холодильника. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nataliya is a kind and honest woman.  She is 54 years old.  She is divorced.  Her husband left her, and she was left without a provider.  Nataliya has been working at a private production organization for over ten years.  She is a hardworking woman and this is why she does quality work.  She is a manager of the preparation department.  She provides for herself and does not rely on anyone because she does not have children.  She wants to purchase an air conditioner because she gets very hot during summer, and furniture for her house.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy furniture and an air conditioner.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy furniture and an air conditioner

loans.name: Syrayo

texts.en:
A kind woman by the name of Syrayo lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works as master carpenter. They have four clever children. One of them is an adult and three of them are not yet adults. 

Syrayo began her business selling food items four years ago. Her store is located near her house.  Some years ago, she and her husband bought a plot of  land and began to build a house. It takes a lot of work  to build a complete house. She has to make a roof, do plastering and install doors and windows.

Syrayo is asking for a loan of 14,000 Somoni to rebuild her house. In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for rebuilding house

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a 55-year-old married father of six from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. This marks his fifth loan term with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

With the loan he has applied from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer. The additional income created will allow him cater to his family’s needs and repay his loan. 

In the future, Simon would like to educate his children. 

He hopes to start exporting his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita is a 47-year-old  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children ages 6 and 18 years old. She runs a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She sells items like noodles, local vinegar, canned goods, biscuits, soaps, shampoo and condiments. She has been doing 'sari-sari' store business for more than five years.

To be able to maintain her store inventory, Avita  requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more stock like soft drinks, seasonings, beverages and toiletries. In the future, Avita would like to expand her 'sari-sari' into a mini-mart to have higher income and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks, seasonings, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old, married to Juma, and they have four children who are in school.

She has been selling fish in Naivasha for the the past nineteen years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more fish.With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, Mary hopes to have the biggest fish selling business in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 45 years old and a butchery owner in Thika. He is married to Nancy, a farmer, and they are blessed with two children. 

Peter has been running the butchery business for the past ten years successfully with a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to provide for his family. 

Peter is applying for his first loan with KADET;  he will use the loan to buy more goats and chickens for slaughtering. With the anticipated profits from the business he will open another butchery.  

He hopes and dreams of having a comfortable life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy more goats and chickens

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse, a 72-year-old widowed father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a maize mill which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 5,500 which he uses to support his family. This marks his sixth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Additional income created will allow him improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Jesse would like to retire from farming since he is now old. 

He hopes to construct a permanent residential house and have a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia runs a variety store selling various goods to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. Letecia has been in the business for more than three years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as sodas, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sodas, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. Betty has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 6 years. Fishing is their main source of income. Betty needs a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat such as plywood, nails, paint and other things. With this, they will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the fishing boat. In the future, Betty hopes to make their fishing venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, paint among other things

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia, age 65, is a farmer. She and her husband farm mixed crops to earn a living. Theresia earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. This loan request marks her third loan term with KADET Ltd. after having repaid her previous loans successfully. 

Theresia would like to start a business raising and selling poultry to improve her income. With the loan she has requested from KADET Ltd., she will be able to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed. The additional income generated from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Theresia would like to buy dairy cows. 

She hopes to save enough money to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 65-year-old married mother of one child from Thika. She has been operating a business as a mixed-crop farmer. She is married to Kabue who is also a farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 7,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying her previous loan successfully. 

With the loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and a dairy cow. The additional income will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Esther would like to buy more dairy cows. 

She hopes to save money to educate her child up to university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 41-year-old single mother of one. She earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Nancy is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, toilet paper rolls and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business and use the remaining amount to repay her loan. 

In the future, Nancy plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store and offer her child a quality education.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, toilet paper rolls and flour

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a widowed, 61-year-old mother of two in Mwingi. Anne has been running a hotel business for the past 30 years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. She also runs a small retail shop to supplement her income. Anne is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced to it by an existing KADET client. 

She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereals, onions and cabbage in bulk for her hotel. She will reinvest the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereals, onions and cabbage in bulk

loans.name: Erika Paola

texts.es:
Erika es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Erika ha podido estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación.
Por iniciativa propia, Erika trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño.
Erika se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para su venta, así pues Erika seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Erika is 19 years old, single, and lives in Chincha city with her parents. she is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Erika has been able to study a technical career in computers.

Because of her own initiative, Erika works as a receptionist at a business in the city. In addition she has a small business selling clothing. She works every day for approximately 9 hours and she believes her business is going well because of her good work ethic.

Erika is very grateful to the Kiva supporters, thanks to the support she received she will buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing for her business, so that Erika will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen Nieves

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón ne la vida ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carmen no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Carmen trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artesanías, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, como piedras decorativas, adornos incaicos, platos cuarjos y otros, de esta manera Carmen tendrá su negocio mejora abastecido, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 28 year old woman who lives in Pisco with her small son who she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to helping her family get ahead, as she is both father and mother for her son. Sadly because of a lack of economic resources and because of the need to work, Carmen couldn't study the Business Administration career she wanted. 

By her own initiative, Carmen works in her small business selling artisan handicrafts. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that her business is going well due to her effort and dedication. 

Carmen is grateful to the Kiva supporters, as thanks to the help provided she will buy a greater variety of merchandise, such as decorative rocks, Incan decorations, decorative plates and other items. In this way Carmen will have her business better stocked, thus she will continue working and trying to achieve her great dream of providing an education to her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for the renovation of her fishing boat.

Analiza has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional matetrials for the renovation of her fishing boat

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business; she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old and married with eight children, three whom are in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods like milk, canned goods, soap, egg, etc to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods like milk, canned goods, soap, egg, etc to sell

loans.name: Joeseth

texts.en:
Joeseth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, bamboo, paint, etc for the repair of her fishing boat for her business.

Joeseth has been in this business for six years. Joeseth earns additional income from raising pigs.

Joeseth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, bamboo, paint, etc for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming rice. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Jeimy Patricia

texts.es:
Empresa familiar, ella y su esposo se han dedicado al trabajo en corte y confección desde hace más de 8 años. Hace 2 años deciden emprender su propia empresa, por lo que con sus liquidaciones adquieren equipo e inician su negocio. Con su experiencia y contactos han logrado ofrecer sus productos a varios intermediarios y participan en la feria de Grecia. Su mayor deseo es colocar directamente su producto, para esto solicitan este préstamo, para producir su propia mercadería, sin descuidar a sus clientes. Obtener un mayor margen de ganancia y mejorar el ingreso familiar es su principal objetivo. Ambos trabajaban en empresas maquiladoras y hace 2 años, reciben su liquidación y empiezan su propia microempresa la cual está en proceso de expansión. Han invertido y cuentan con un patrimonio importante.
Con un mercado consolidado, participan semanalmente en la feria de Grecia y además vende su mercadería a varios comerciantes de la zona, cuentan con ingresos para cubrir la cuota de este préstamo. Su objetivo es elaborar mercadería para comercializarla directamente, obteniendo un mayor margen de ganancia y lograr un crecimiento que los lleve a la consolidación. Jeimy al igual que su esposo cuentan con amplia experiencia en el área del corte y confección, es una empresa familiar que ha levantado con capital propio y cuenta a la fecha con equipo y maquinaria que le permiten ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de calidad. Cuentan con un mercado estable y desean producir más para poder venderlo directamente y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia. Se complementa ya que ella es experta  en la confección y él en  corte y comercialización, llevando  Confecciones TyT a consolidarse en el mercado.
texts.en:
For the last eight years, Jeimy and her husband have made a living working in factories for clothing companies. Two years ago, they decided to open their own family business. They bought equipment and started up their business with their severance pay from their previous jobs. With their experience and contacts, Jeimy and her husband have gotten to sell their products to various intermediaries and to participate in the festival in Grecia. Their biggest desire is to sell their products themselves. This is why Jeimy is requesting this loan. She will begin producing her own merchandise without neglecting her current clients. Obtaining a higher profit margin and improving her family's earnings is her principal objective. 

Jeimy and her husband are in the process of expanding their new business. They have invested much of their money and assets into it. With an established stock of merchandise, they sell their clothes at the weekly festivals in Grecia as well as in different stores in the region. From this they earn enough money to make their repayments for this loan. Jeimy's goal is to produce clothing and sell it directly so that she earns more profits from her merchandise and achieve growth that leads to consolidation. Jeimy and her husband each have much experience in dressmaking. They started their family business with their own capital and they already have equipment and machinery that allows them to produce quality products for their clients. There is a steady market for their clothing, so they hope to produce more and sell it directly. Fortunately, she is an expert at making and marketing clothing, so she will bring T&T Apparel to consolidate in the market.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies for making and selling clothing.

loans.name: Florena

texts.en:
Florena is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Florena is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Florena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Florena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Florena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for her restaurant meals, like vegetables, eggs, spices, meat and fish.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her restaurant meals, like vegetables, meat and fish

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is 37 years old and married. She has five children. She earns a living by farming corn, in the Philippines. She has been farming corn for 17 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 6500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Rolina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 44 years old, married, and has two sons. Her husband is a laborer. Hien has been running a general store in front of her door, for 11 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and to generate income with which to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hien is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying more household items to stock in her store, including sugar, milk, and rice. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest into her business in the future

loans.use: To buy more household items to stock in her store, including sugar, milk, and rice

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 42 years old, is married and has two children. She and her husband support their family through the income they earn by selling many kinds of water pipes. They have been engaged in this business for nineteen years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Yen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital, buying water pipes. The additional supply of pipes will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy water pipes to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 40 years old and married. She has two children, and she lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income, as a turner. Lien runs a business of making clothes, at her house. She started her business 23 years ago.

Lien intends to take a loan, in order to gradually expand her business by buying a sewing machine and materials. These purchases will help her to better satisfy the demands of her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is single and has been blessed with one child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. She cites food and electricity bills as her major challenges.

She operates a pub business where she sells beer to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase eight crates of beer to sell. 

Mirriam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Wilbroda

texts.en:
Wilbroda is married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. She cites food and school fees as her major challenges.

She has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business, selling retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: José Alcides

texts.es:
José tiene 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajos del hogar, han procreado tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, todos viven con él y estudian. 

Por su parte, él se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 11 años de dedicarse a esta actividad productiva, el oficio lo aprendió del esposo de una tía suya,. Se vio en la necesidad de aprender con otra persona, debido a que sus padres no lo criaron y fue su tía quien todo el tiempo cuido de él. Otro oficio que realiza, es el de la albañilería. El lugar donde cultiva esta aproximadamente a 500 mts de su casa, y revise ayuda para cultivar  de su esposa y su hija mayor.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar la semilla, abonos, insecticidas y herbicidas y para cancelar el alquiler de la tierra. con la producción piensa cancelar el préstamo y con las ganancias tiene pensado iniciar un negocio de venta de biblias e himnarios y la necesidad que sera satisfecha es que podrá sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno.

Don José ha tenido un sueño  toda la vida y consiste en poseer un negocio propio y un vehículo para movilizarse con toda su familia. Otro sueño es dejarles donde vivir a sus hijos, espera que el próximo año pueda sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados  mas de terreno; pero sabe que solo luchando por seguir adelante y con el apoyo de los créditos vera cumplido sus sueños.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old, completed a 3rd grade education, is married, and his wife takes care of their home. They have three children ages 15, 12, and 9, who live with him and are in school.

José has been a farmer for 11 years, a profession he learned from the husband of one of his aunts. He needed to learn from someone else since his parents didn't raise him and it was his aunt who always took care of him. Another job he has is as a brick layer. He farms in a location approximately 500 meters from his home, and his wife and oldest daughter help with the farming.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide and to pay off the rent for the farmland. With the harvest he plans to repay the loan and with the earnings he is planning to start a business selling bibles and hymnals. He plans on being able to plant 7000 square meters of land.

José has had a dream all his life of owning his own business and vehicle in order to transport his family. Another dream is to have a place where his children can live, he hopes next year to plan 7000 square meters more of land, but he knows that only by working hard will he be successful and with the support of his loans he wil see his dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, and payoff farmland rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuffs like flour, cooking oil, firewood, and other utensils

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani lives in Kaloleni which is a few miles from Mariakani town in Kenya. He is 31 years old and married with three children. He started up a motorcycle transport business  five years ago and the business is doing great. He shares that before getting into the business he used to do casual jobs which gave him little income, but he saved the income then managed to buy a motorcycle and that's how the business got up and running. 

He learned about Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund the business. He now seeks a loan to buy a motorbike. The challenge in the business is high fuel costs, which cut into his income, and inflation. Despite the challenges in the business, he is determined to own his own company supplying motorbikes in town. The extra income that he will earn from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a businessman who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 38-year-old married man with three children. 

Kennedy runs a money transfer business known locally as M-pesa. He is employed elsewhere, and he has employed someone to run this business on his behalf. 

He learned of Milango through friends, and he now seeks a loan to add to his float account so that he can serve more people and earn more income from the business. The challenges in the business have been to find customers and competition from other traders. 

Despite the challenges, he is looking forward to opening other branches of the business. The extra income raised will help him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to add to his float account for his mobile phone service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new plants for his land.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура добрая, жизнерадостная  женщина в возрасти 47 лет. Она замужем ,имеет троих детей, двоих сыновей и одну дочку.   Она работает в деканском хозяйстве и дополнительно занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной  продукции.  Муж и двое  сыновей  работают в России, . А её дочь тоже летом  ездит в Россию чтобы помочь братьям. 
Дети  Манзуры стали взрослыми и им нужно обзаводится своими семьями. Но для этого нужны большие расходы поэтому дети тоже стараются помогать матери и зарабатывают денежные средства. На данный момент Манзура начала ремонт в своем доме.  Чтобы закончить ремонт ей не хватает немного денежных средств. Посоветовавшись с мужем и детьми Манзура решила обратится в организацию Арванд за кредитом. Она уверена, что Арванд не оставит ее без внимания и финансово поддержит. Манзура на полученный кредит планирует купить строительные материалы и закончить ремонт дома до приезда  своих детей.
texts.en: Manzura is a kind and happy 47 year-old woman.  She is married and has three children - two sons and one daughter.  She works at a dekhan farm and is additionally involved in growing agricultural crops.  Her husband and two sons work in Russia.  And her daughter also goes to Russia in the summer to help her brothers.  Manzura's children grew up and now need to get their own families, but a lot of expenses are involved in this, and this is why the children try to help their mother and earn money.  After a discussion with her husband and children, Manzura decided to request a loan from the Arvand organization.  She is convinced that Arvand will not leave her without attention and will financially support her.  Manzura plans to use this loan to buy construction materials and complete the repair of her house prior to her children's return.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and complete the repair of her house

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in ceramics and handcrafted jewelry. He wants to buy clay for his handcrafted ceramics and also the soapstone he uses in his jewelry.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"With a background in arts, I decided to specialize in ceramic artistry. There are more than 70 women training with me, and they come from various villages, mostly from the Volta Region. They specialize in traditional pottery and I introduce contemporary designs. I also design and craft jewelry. I use materials such as soapstone powder fired and finished in a similar manner as my ceramic ornaments collection. I design and craft every bead by hand at my workshop."

"I thank all of you for your generous assistance. I promise to produce some new designs to show my gratitude."

Use the link below to view Samuel's ceramics and handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1134

loans.use: to buy clay for his handcrafted ceramics and also the soapstone he uses in his jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lesly Jessenia

texts.es:
Lesly es una joven de 23 años de edad madre de una hija la cual tiene 2 años de edad con 9 años de educación primaria. En compañía de su pareja se dedican al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café actividad que es y ha sido en su familia medio de ingreso económico para poder cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar entre otras. Ella tiene más de 6 años de experiencia en dichas actividades ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. La tierra que ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja es propia gracias al esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación que han puesto para evitar alquilar las cuales están ubicadas a 20 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie.

En vista de las dificultadas en la baja de los precios del café y el incremento de los insumos en el mercado ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 13 sacos de abono, fertilizante y con otra parte del dinero pagara el acarreo de los insumos que será trasladado en carro particular hasta su casa de habitación.

Los planes a futuro son los de poder extender más sus cultivos de café, ofreciendo una mejor calidad mediante la siembra de nueva chapola como el caturra, borbone que son más atractivos y competitivos en el mercado. Como madre darle a su hija sus estudios y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lesly is a young 23 year old mother of a two year old child.  She has nine years of basic education.  Along with her partner she works growing corn, beans and coffee.  This economic activity has been in her family a primary mode of income and method for paying basic household necessities. She has more than six years of experience in this field since her parents taught her to work the land from a very young age.  The land that she and her partner work is their own thanks to their hard work and dedication, which has allowed them to avoid renting the plot about 20 minutes from their home.  They walk to their fields.  

In light of the challenges created by the lower coffee prices, as well as increasing food prices in the market, Lesly is asking for a loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL, with which she will purchase fertilizers as well as pay for transportation costs to get these products from the market to her home. 

Her future plans are to increase the cultivation of coffee, offering a better quality by planting different types of plants (like caturra and borbone) which are more attractive and competitive in the current market.  As a mother she wants to give her daughter the opportunity to study and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase products for growing coffee

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, desde hace 2 años tiene un puesto de venta de pupusas en su lugar de residencia, es un apersona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta, los clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad y buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una plancha para hacer las pupusas y los materiales que necesita como: chicharrón, maíz, frijol, quesillo, tomates, repollos, etc. para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children.  She's a very hardworking, responsible, and honest person.

She has sold pupusas [stuffed tortillas] in a stall in her house for two years.  Customers prefer her because she's friendly and has good prices.  With her earnings she's able to pay some of the household expenses.

Ana's requesting a loan to buy a grill to make pupusas as well as the ingredients she needs, such as cracklings, corn, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

This way she'll be able to continue with her business, which is her only source of income, and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for pupusas
